summary:
I am a scientist working on sustainable chains with the two focus areas:
•	Identifying and studying sustainable biobased and circular chains
•	Quantifying and optimising sustainability performance during early design stages of (process) chains.

Core of my expertise is developing simulation and optimisation models that quantitatively address the sustainability performance. In such models principles from operations management systems analysis, process engineering, and sustainability analysis (e.g. LCA) are combined. My research interest is for, but not limited to, the research fields biobased economy, biotechnology, and circular chains.
Publications can be found at: https://research.wur.nl/en/persons/ellen-slegers/publications/ 

Next to research I have a passion for teaching, either by supervising students during their thesis research or by developing and teaching courses related to Sustainability Analysis.

Experienced user of software programs Matlab, SimaPro, AIMMS, eSankey and Mathcad. Experience with GAMS, ArcGIS and SuperProDesigner

education.field_of_study: Dutch, English, Latin, Mathematics (B1,2), Physics, Chemistry, Biology

projects.title: 7th FrameWork Program MIRACLES
projects.description:
MIRACLES is an industry-driven R&D and innovation project aimed at developing integrated, multiple-product biorefinery technologies for the production of specialties from microalgae for application in food, aquaculture and non-food products.

Tasks involved in: 
◦To generate conceptual biorefinery design models for techno-economic and sustainability assessment 
◦To assess the economics and sustainability of the biorefinery concepts and value chain, employing techno-economic evaluation, state-of-the-art Life Cycle assessment methodology, and socio-economic assessment

projects.title: AlgaePARC Biorefinery
projects.description:
Aim: develop innovative, scalable technologies for biorefinery of commodities (lipids, proteins, carbohydrates) from microalgae

Tasks: Systems Analysis and sustainability assessment
The aim of this work is to perform Life Cycle Assessment driven design of integral algae biorefineries including processing conditions and product routing and resource recovery based on input of data by the project partners. Furthermore the work will address integration of the algae biorefinery within the supply chain.

projects.title: BeWhere Algae
projects.description:
BeWhere Algae is a long running project aiming at developing and extending a logistic model to 
-geographical siting of algae plants, 
-allocation of resources,
-cost/energy/LCA evaluation of large scale algae production

Project is a cooperation of Wageningen University (Ellen Slegers) and IIASA (BeWhere team at ESM group)

projects.title: New course Sustainability Analysis
projects.description:
Developing new course on Sustainability Analysis. Funded by the Centre for Biobased Economy(CBBE). Responsibilities: 
-full coordination of course
-accomodation in study programmes Biosystems Engineering and Biotechnology
-development of course materials (lectures, reader, exercises, case studies)
-organisation of lecture team
-examinor

projects.title: Wetsus (Algae theme)
projects.description: Focus of the algae theme is sustainable biotechnology for the production of valuable products. I worked on the PhD project "Advanced scenarios studies for large scale microalgae cultivation". This work resulted in my phd thesis entitled: Scenario studies for algae production

profile_positions.description:
Assistant Professor 'Sustainable Chains' (Tenure Track position), working on two focus areas:
•	Identifying and studying sustainable biobased and circular chains
•	Quantifying and optimising sustainability performance during early design stages of (process) chains.

Methods from operations management, system analysis and sustainability analysis are combined and expanded to work on the beforementioned focus areas.
profile_positions.title: Assistant Professor

profile_positions.description:
Representing Wageningen University in the Subject Area BioEconomy. One of the joint activities is a yearly Summer School for MSc students, taking place at one of the Bioeconomy universities. 
2020: University of Natural Resources and Life Sciences (BOKU) in Vienna, Austria
2019: Czech University of Life Science in Prague, Czech Republic
2018: University of Hohenheim, Germany
https://www.euroleague-study.org/en/bioeconomy-2019
profile_positions.title: WUR representative Subject Area BioEconomy

profile_positions.description: nova-Institute is a private and independent institute, founded in 1994; nova offers research and consultancy with a focus on bio-based and CO2-based economy in the fields of feedstock, techno-economic evaluation, markets, LCA, dissemination, B2B communication and policy. Internet: www.nova-institut.eu and www.bio-based.eu
profile_positions.title: Scientist

profile_positions.description:
Postdoc research in the chair group Biobased Chemistry and Technology. Main research projects are "AlgaePARC biorefinery" and "EU MIRACLES". The research projects focus on integrated sustainable biorefineries. This work included modelling the processing of algae biomass into various products and logistics. 
In addition, I developed and lectures a new course “Sustainability Analysis” (6 ECTS, aimed at 3rd year BSc students).
profile_positions.title: Postdoctoral Researcher

profile_positions.description:
My PhD project is on the design of efficient, robust and flexible algae plants using an advanced scenario study approach. The project was part of the theme "Algen" of knowledge institute Wetsus.
Title PhD thesis: Scenario studies for algae production (defended 21 March 2014)
profile_positions.title: PhD student

profile_positions.description: Organizing (network) events for young employees of the Agrotechnology and Food Sciences Group within Wageningen UR.
profile_positions.title: Member of Young AFSG

profile_positions.description: Within the Young Scientist Summer Program (YSSP) I have performed part of my PhD research, aiming at the development of a method to determine the optimal location for algae plants, based on biomass production and resource supply. This work resulted in one publication.
